description.narrative: Objective: to improve livelihoods for ASMEs operating along the Development Minerals value chain in ACP countries

activity-description.narrative: Programme focus country. ACP-EU Development Minerals Programme: Phase II

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative: 1.1a Number of ACP countries with new or improved policies, laws, regulations to facilitate formalization, gender inclusion and business development of ASMEs 1.1b Number of ASMEs that are formalized and/or access extension services through programme support 1.2 Number of ACP countries with geo-data maps created/ geo-data inventories conducted and experts trained in geodata collection and digitization 2.1 Number of ASMEs/ cooperatives/chambers/ associations trained in enterprise management and related technical skills demonstrating improved practices 2.2 Number of ASMEs that applied for / obtained small grants, credit or other financial products from financial institutions and other actors 3.1a Number of ASMEs/cooperatives, civil society groups, academia, regulators trained in mine and quarry management/number of selected participants who have developed return-to-work plans (RWPs) on environmental management, occupational safety and health, and gender inclusion 3.1b Number of training programs with thematic relevance to Development Minerals developed and delivered by universities, colleges, training centres, business development consultancies, associations and other training entities 3.2 Number of ASME operators, community members, CSO staff, academia, regulators and local governments staff trained and implementing improved community engagement/conflict management and protection of human rights/labour/gender/child rights 4.1a Number of women ASMEs/cooperatives/ associations receiving support in enterprise development, business management and related technical skills 4.1b Number of staff of regulatory agencies, local governments, potential buyer companies and financial institutions trained in gender equality and women empowerment, with the application of these principles in the Development Minerals sector 4.2 Number of government institutions and private sector companies with gender-responsive procurement policies and practices 5.1 Number of research studies conduct

comment.narrative:
Output 1: Institutions in ACP countries have improved business enabling environment for gender-inclusive, operationalisation and formalisation of ASMEs along the Development Minerals value chain - 8 ACP countries with new or improved policies, laws, regulations to facilitate formalisation, gender inclusion and business development of ASMEs - 4475 ASMEs that are formalised and/or access extension services through programme support - 6 ACP countries with geodata maps created/geodata inventories conducted and experts trained in geodata collection and digitisation
Output 2: ASMEs have enhanced entrepreneurial skills and access to finance, technology, markets and market information; and better regulations - 1258 ASMEs/cooperatives/chambers/associations trained in enterprise management and related technical skills demonstrating improved practices - 60 ASMEs that applied for/obtained small grants credit or other financial products from financial institutions and other actors
Output 3: Public institutions, communities, women’s organisations and CSOs have strengthened capacity to put in place social and environmental safeguards in mining and quarrying of Development Minerals - 299 ASMEs/cooperatives, civil society groups, academia, regulators trained in mine and quarry management/number of selected participants who have developed return-to-work plans (RWPs) on environmental management, occupational safety and health, and gender inclusion - 42 training programmes with thematic relevance to the Development Minerals developed by universities, colleges, training centres, business development consultancies, associations, and other training entities - 94 ASME operators, community members, CSO staff, academia, regulators and local governments staff trained and implementing improved community engagement/conflict management and protection of human rights/labour/gender/child rights
Output 4: Women-owned ASMEs are supported to operate in the Development of Minerals value-chain -

Increased employment and income for artisanal and small-scale mining enterprises (ASMEs), and in particular increased economic opportunities for women participating in ASMEs throughout the Development Minerals value chain Output 1: - A firm was successfully contracted to develop a strategy for formalization and business development acceleration for the Development Minerals sector in Uganda. The process was concluded end-Feb, 2021.
Output 2: - Three firms have been awarded grants to pilot inclusive business eco-system project targeting youth in Uganda.
Output 3: N/A
Output 4: - Study on enhancing womens participation in the Development Minerals sector in Uganda has been finalised and printed for dissemination in different fora.
Output 5: Various knowledge sharing events were held to showcase opportunities for youth in the extractives sector including development minerals as well as to highlight the issue and solutions to gender-based violence in the context of women in mining. In total, over 500 youth were reached over online engagements platforms and over 300,000 Ugandans were reached over social media; tv broadcast and 100 YouTube views with messaging on financing mineral value chains for women and addressing GBV in the mining sector.

Output 1 1 ACP country with new or improved policies, laws, regulations to facilitate formalisation, gender inclusion and business development of ASMEs 185 ASMEs that are formalised and/or access extension services through programme support 1 ACP country with geo-data maps created/ geo-data inventories conducted and experts trained in geodata collection and digitisation
Output 2 200 ASMEs/ cooperatives/chambers/ associations trained in enterprise management and related technical skills demonstrating improved practices 94/53 ASMEs that applied for / obtained small grants, credit or other financial products from financial institutions and other actors
Output 3 245 ASMEs/cooperatives, civil society groups, academia, regulators trained in mine and quarry management/number of selected participants who have developed return-to-work plans (RWPs) on environmental management, occupational safety and health, and gender inclusion 7 training programs with thematic relevance to Development Minerals developed and delivered by universities, colleges, training centres, business development consultancies, associations and other training entities 60 ASME operators, community members, CSO staff, academia, regulators and local governments staff trained and implementing improved community engagement/conflict management and protection of human rights/labour/gender/child rights
Output 4 324 women ASMEs/cooperatives/ associations receiving support in enterprise development, business management and related technical skills 67 staff of regulatory agencies, local governments, potential buyer companies and financial institutions trained in gender equality and women empowerment, with the application of these principles in the Development Minerals sector 18 government institutions and private sector companies with gender-responsive procurement policies and practices
Output 5 4 research studies conducted, including on sustainable development, climate change, disaster risk management and Development Minerals 500 stakeholders who have increased knowledge and positive attitude towards ASMEs and gender inclusion, affirmative procurement policies in Development Minerals because of South-South knowledge exchange activities organised on Development Minerals

Output 1 No new or improved policies, laws, regulations to facilitate formalisation, gender inclusion and business development of ASMEs No ASMEs that are formalised and/or access extension services through programme support geo-data maps created/ geo-data inventories conducted and experts trained in geodata collection and digitisation
Output 2 258 ASMEs/ cooperatives/chambers/ associations trained in enterprise management and related technical skills demonstrating improved practices 12 ASMEs obtained small grants
Output 3 No ASMEs/cooperatives, civil society groups, academia, regulators trained in mine and quarry management The programme has initiated collaboration with a vocational skilling center to co-design and pilot a curriculum tailored to respond to market demand of the necessary skills to spur innovation and value addition in the Development Minerals sector. No ASME operators, community members, CSO staff, academia, regulators and local governments staff trained in improved community engagement/conflict management and protection of human rights/labour/gender/child rights
Output 4 5 women ASMEs/cooperatives/ associations receiving support in enterprise development, business management and related technical skills No staff of regulatory agencies, local governments, potential buyer companies and financial institutions trained in gender equality and women empowerment, with the application of these principles in the Development Minerals sector No government institutions and private sector companies with gender-responsive procurement policies and practices
Output 5 ASME formalization and business development acceleration assessment and strategy developed The strategy contributed to South-South knowledge sharing, providing inputs to the Africa continental ASM strategy and guideline 97 stakeholders who have increased knowledge and positive attitude towards ASMEs and gender inclusion, affirmative procurement policies in Development Minerals
